vulnerabilities.title: Auth Bypass in Example Corp
vulnerabilities.description: Discovered Authentication bypass via parameter manipulation affecting Example Corp. The application does not properly sanitize user input, allowing an attacker to inject malicious payloads that are executed by the application.
vulnerabilities.impact: An attacker can exploit this vulnerability to bypass authentication mechanisms and access restricted functionality.
reproduction_steps: Observe that the payload is executed
vulnerabilities.proof_of_concept:
# Proof of Concept

Payload: See steps

This demonstrates Authentication bypass via parameter manipulation

# Validation at 2025-11-10T04:41:09.736324
Validation successful with alternative payload at 2025-11-10T04:41:09.736321
vulnerabilities.remediation: Review authentication logic thoroughly. Implement multi-factor authentication. Use secure session management and properly validate all authentication tokens.

vulnerabilities.title: Ssrf in Example Corp
vulnerabilities.description: Discovered Server-Side Request Forgery via URL params affecting Example Corp. The application does not properly sanitize user input, allowing an attacker to inject malicious payloads that are executed by the application.
vulnerabilities.impact: An attacker can exploit this vulnerability to make requests to internal systems and potentially access sensitive data.
reproduction_steps: Observe that the payload is executed
vulnerabilities.proof_of_concept:
# Proof of Concept

Payload: http://localhost

This demonstrates Server-Side Request Forgery via URL params

# Validation at 2025-11-10T04:41:09.736339
Validation successful with alternative payload at 2025-11-10T04:41:09.736337
vulnerabilities.remediation: Validate and sanitize all URLs. Implement allowlist of permitted domains. Use network segmentation to limit internal access.

vulnerabilities.title: Path Traversal in Example Corp
vulnerabilities.description: Discovered Path traversal in file operations affecting Example Corp. The application does not properly sanitize user input, allowing an attacker to inject malicious payloads that are executed by the application.
vulnerabilities.impact: An attacker can exploit this vulnerability to read arbitrary files on the server filesystem.
reproduction_steps: Observe that the payload is executed
vulnerabilities.proof_of_concept:
# Proof of Concept

Payload: ../../../etc/passwd

This demonstrates Path traversal in file operations
vulnerabilities.remediation: Validate file paths against allowlist. Use secure APIs that prevent directory traversal. Implement proper access controls on filesystem operations.
